etymology.description: Line on the hand (ideographic) emphasizing the elbow -> represents measurement unit between wrist and specific forearm position -> meaning 'inch'
etymology.interpretation: 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch") originated as a depiction of a line on the hand, indicating the area near the elbow. This specific placement was considered significant for pulse palpation, originally suggesting a forearm position, which then came to denote the measurement 'inch'.

examples.chinese: 这块布每一寸都是精心制作(這塊布每一寸都是精心製作)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuài bù měi yī cùn dōu shì jīngxīn zhìzuò.
examples.english: Every inch of this cloth is crafted with care.

examples.chinese: 请用卷尺量一寸(請用卷尺量一寸)，每一寸数据都准确(每一寸數據都準確)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng yòng juǎnchǐ liàng yī cùn, měi yī cùn shùjù dōu zhǔnquè.
examples.english: Please use a tape measure to measure an inch, every inch's data is accurate.
